text: After many years of usage I'm deleting WhatsApp, Facebook, Instagram, and Facebook Messenger. I strongly encourage you to do the same, and encourage everyone in your network to do the same.

@brandur It's very easy to switch everyone you know over when there is a mass exodus. The reason it works is that everyone is getting messages like these from a couple of friends, not just you. You couldn't have done this a month ago.

urls.title: My Substack stats
urls.description: Many people are secretive about their Substack numbers, but the whole point of Zero Credibility is to write about topics others stay away from. Today I want to share this newsletter's metrics to give you a realistic sense of what's possible to achieve on the platform.

text:

text: Finished Michael Lewis's The New New Thing. It's entertaining in the same way the TV show Silicon Valley is entertaining, and contains many facts. But I got zero information about what Jim Clark thought about anything. Don't recommend it.
Out of every platform/network you’re on, where do you get the most signal for smart ppl doing interesting things?
@UsernameQne @Cernovich If you’re a CEO and you want an organized group of whack jobs that you cannot legally fire making insane demands, please enjoy yourself.

@LongTran02 👇

https://t.co/fqOto9WQY9

@matech5 @LongTran02 Unions lower labor productivity. The organization becomes less competitive, often dramatically so. This is worthwhile when labor has little power (e.g. unskilled workers) because it increases quality of life. When labor has power, the inefficiency isn't a good tradeoff.
@SapperNYC This path is definitely not for everyone.

@LongTran02 Unions are good for the world in sectors where capital has more power than labor and bad for the world in sectors where labor has more power than capital. The tech industry is undeniably the latter.
@SapperNYC My burn rate is next to nothing and I don’t work.

@default_friend There is no question some programmers are worth $5m total comp. Most are worth nothing (actually less than nothing). All the boot camp graduates and even college CS graduates are worthless. TL;DR: I support this message.
@ThisIsCriticus Have them fire themselves, like Coinbase did. There are ways around these things.
@Appyg99 All the other tech CEOs rn https://t.co/7fidYYunal
@Appyg99 @default_friend 😂
@default_friend It’s a vehicle for spreading wokeness, has nothing to do with working conditions.
